<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_ModuleInfo:
```c
int32 OS_ModuleInfo(osal_id_t module_id, OS_module_prop_t *module_prop)
{
    OS_common_record_t *         record;
    OS_module_internal_record_t *module;
    int32                        return_code;
    OS_object_token_t            token;

    /* Check parameters */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(module_prop);

    memset(module_prop, 0, sizeof(OS_module_prop_t));

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_GLOBAL, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, module_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        record = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_global_module_table, token);
        module = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_module_table, token);

        strncpy(module_prop->name, record->name_entry, sizeof(module_prop->name) - 1);
        strncpy(module_prop->filename, module->file_name, sizeof(module_prop->filename) - 1);

        return_code = OS_ModuleGetInfo_Impl(&token, module_prop);

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```

<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
strncpy(module_prop->filename, module->file_name, sizeof(module_prop->filename) - 1);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. Both module_prop->filename and module->file_name are arrays of size OS_MAX_PATH_LEN; the call uses n = sizeof(module_prop->filename) - 1 (i.e. OS_MAX_PATH_LEN - 1), so strncpy copies at most OS_MAX_PATH_LEN - 1 bytes, which is within the bounds of both source and destination. Additionally, module_prop was zeroed beforehand (memset), ensuring a trailing NUL byte remains. Therefore this use of strncpy does not access beyond object bounds.
